pageContext.claim: “We had a guy -- a radical Islamic terrorist in New York -- area I know very well -- driving down the West Side highway. ....And 8 people died; 12 or 13 were injured.... And he's allowed to have his family come here. So they checked, and they said that he had about 22 people came in -- chain migration. In other words, because he's here -- so a whole group of people come in....Think of it: This man that killed 8 people and so badly injured 12, they say he's about 22 relatives coming in that are here. And take a look at how well his relatives are doing. It's not a good picture.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump says terror suspect Sayfullo Habibullaevic Saipov brought 22 relatives into the United States through "chain migration" or the diversity visa lottery. But no agency has confirmed this figure and experts say it is implausible because Saipov only had a green card. That means he could only bring in his wife (already in the U.S.) or his minor children (already U.S. citizens).
